TITLE.P: The VHF Frequency Modulated (FM) Broadcast Transmitters

SHORT_DESCR.P: The BBC World Service is a leading international broadcaster with 40 language service and a global radio audience of over 160 000 000. World Service broadcasts through different platforms including local FM transmitter relays globally.

Following an expansion of FM relays at the beginning of the last decade and the key strategic objectives which include, growth of the worldwide presence of the World Service, BBC World Service is intending to replace up to 100 FM transmitters of various power levels with drives / amplifier systems, over the next 4 years or longer. Some of the locations include Africa, the Middle East etc.

The document is to notify potential suppliers of an open tender procedure for a supply of transmitters to the UK. The BBC is seeking to establish a Framework Agreement with 3 Lots, with companies which will qualify to supply to the BBC transmitter systems comprising drive / exciters and amplifier(s) of nominal 300 / 500 watt, 1kW, 2kW and 3kW RF output power.

LOT_COMBINING_CONTRACT_RIGHT.P: The Framework Agreement will comprise of 3 lots.

TITLE.P: Dual drive system transmitter with multiple ‘hot pluggable’ amplifiers and power supplies

SHORT_DESCR.P: Purchase of the transmitter systems comprising drive / exciters and amplifier(s) of nominal 300 / 500 watt, 1kW, 2kW and 3kW RF output power.

In this version along with changeover at the drive, slide in replacement of lightweight units will be easily achieved with little experience of the equipment and without removing plugs and connectors.

TITLE.P: Transmitter with dual drives and dual amplifiers with either a splitter/combiner or relay selection for the amplifier system

SHORT_DESCR.P: Supply of Transmitter systems comprising drive / exciters and amplifier(s) of nominal 300 / 500 watt, 1kW, 2kW and 3kW RF output power to the UK from the manufacturing origin. In these designs there is changeover at the drive and also different methods of ensuring resilience to keep a service on the air.

TITLE.P: Either a single unit drive / amplifier or separate unit drive and amplifier; with 2 similar systems and a changeover and control unit at the amplifier output this will make a 1+1 system

SHORT_DESCR.P: The BBC is looking for a supplier to supply transmitters systems comprising drive / exciters and amplifier(s) of nominal 300 / 500 watt, 1kW, 2kW and 3kW RF output power from the country of manufacturing origin to the UK. This lot is for either a single unit drive / amplifier or separate unit drive and amplifier transmitter; with two sub-similar systems and a changeover and control unit at the amplifier output this will make a 1+1 system.

SUITABILITY.P: List and brief description of conditions:

Where there is more than one economic operator, the BBC reserves the right to require a grouping of economic operators to take a particular legal form or to require a single economic operator to take primary liability or to require that each party undertakes joint and several liability.
To bid in this tender please register your interest in this project by taking the following steps:
1 - Register your company on the BravoSolution e-Tendering portal (this is only required once):
1.1 - Go to https://bbc.bravosolution.co.uk.
1.2 - Click the link on the login page to Register.
1.3 - Accept the terms and conditions and click ‘Continue'.
1.4 - Enter your correct business and user details.
1.5 - Note the username you chose and click ‘Save' when complete.
1.6 - You will shortly receive an email with your temporary password.
2 - Express an Interest in the tender:
2.1 - Login to the portal with the username/password.
2.2 - Click the ‘ITTs Open To All Suppliers' link. (This is the Invitation to Tender open to any registered supplier).
2.3 - Click on the relevant ITT to access the content.
2.4 - Click the ‘Express Interest' button at the top of the page. This will move the ITT into your ‘My ITTs' page. (This is a secure area reserved for your projects only.
2.5 - You can now access any attachments by clicking ‘Buyer Attachments' in the ' ITT Details' box.
3. Responding to the tender:
3.1 - Click ‘My Response' under ‘ ITT Details', you can choose to ‘Create Response' or to ‘Decline to Respond' (please give a reason if declining).
3.2 - You can now use the ‘Messages' function to communicate with the buyer and seek any clarification.

3.3 - Note the deadline for completion, then follow the onscreen instructions to complete the ITT There may be a mixture of online and offline actions for you to perform (there is detailed online help available).

3.4 - You must then submit your reply using the ‘Submit Response' button at the top of the page. If you require any further assistance please consult the online help, or contact the Bravo e-Tendering help desk.

PERFORMANCE_CONDITIONS.P: List and brief description of conditions:
The technical competency of the Tendering companies will be evaluated as per the Article 68 Directive 2014/24/EU and the Public Contracts Regulations 2015, and the BBC's discretionary judgement.

The BBC will firstly assess if the Tenderers' meet the "qualification envelope" minimum requirements and only once the minimum mandatory requirements are met, the Tenderers' capability will be evaluated by scoring the "Technical Envelope" questions.

FRAMEWORK.JUSTIFICATION: N/A. The agreement is envisaged to run for 3 years.

PLACE.P: Online via the Bravo Solution Portal.

INFO_ADD.P: In the case of technical requirements, the BBC may involve its distribution partner (Babcock International Group Plc) to assist in the scoping and drafting of invitations to tender and/or the evaluation of tenders .However, the final decision as to which is the most economically advantageous (by reference to the award criteria) will be made by the BBC. The awarding authority reserves the right not to award a contract and to annul the procurement process at any stage. It is preferred that Tenders and all supporting documents are priced in sterling (GBP), yet, submissions in USD and EUR are accepted. The contract shall be subject to English law. The awarding authority does not bind itself to accept the lowest, or any tender and reserves the right to accept part of a tender unless the tenderer expressly stipulates otherwise in the tender document.
